intro: Masdevallia strigosa, commonly known as the hairy masdevallia, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and covered in fine, hairy structures, which give it its common name. Masdevallia strigosa is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
